title: KITAB-Bench: A Comprehensive Multi-Domain Benchmark for Arabic OCR and Document Understanding
author: Ahmed Heakl (MBZUAI), Abdullah Sohail (MBZUAI), Mukul Ranjan (MBZUAI), Rania Hossam (MBZUAI), Ghazi Ahmed (Monta AI), Mohamed El-Geish (Monta AI), Omar Maher (Monta AI), Zhiqiang Shen (MBZUAI), ..., Salman Khan (MBZUAI)
relevance_why: The benchmark introduces evaluation metrics and methodologies that could inspire similar frameworks in audio tasks, particularly those involving text recognition and structure in audio transcripts.
background: Creating a benchmark specifically designed for Optical Character Recognition (OCR) systems for Arabic documents, aiming to facilitate the evaluation of current technologies across multiple types of documents.
contribution: KITAB-Bench introduces a diverse benchmark dataset of 8,809 samples to solve the limitations of existing Arabic OCR benchmarks, achieving a comprehensive evaluation framework.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous Arabic OCR datasets focused primarily on specific tasks like handwritten text recognition, lacking a holistic evaluation for various document types.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances the benchmark by including a wider range of document types, sophisticated evaluation metrics, and tasks particularly aimed at resolving real-world OCR challenges.

key_innovation: The introduction of a multi-domain benchmark that allows for rigorous assessments of various OCR capabilities, including table recognition and document structure understanding in Arabic contexts.
real_world_impact: This benchmark has the potential to significantly improve the development of Arabic OCR technologies and document understanding systems, impacting storytelling, education, and resource accessibility.
limitations: The benchmark does not fully cover historical manuscripts and low-resource dialects, which may limit its applicability in some contexts.

new_terms.Optical Character Recognition (OCR): **Optical Character Recognition (OCR)** is a technology that enables the conversion of different types of documents, such as scanned paper documents, PDFs, or images captured by a digital camera, into editable and searchable data.
new_terms.Character Error Rate (CER): **Character Error Rate (CER)** is a metric used to evaluate the accuracy of OCR outputs, calculated as the number of incorrect characters divided by the total number of characters in the ground truth.

open_sourcing: Dataset and benchmarks are accessible through the project website: https://mbzuai-oryx.github.io/KITAB-Bench/
